intro: Brassica cheiranthos var. gracilis, commonly known as slender wallflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, four-petaled flowers and capsule fruits. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in full sun. It has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves, and its flowers range in color from yellow to orange. This variety is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often cultivated in gardens for its vibrant blooms.
